title: Authors and Citation
text: Emanuele Giorgi. Author, maintainer. Claudio Fronterre. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Giorgi E (2024). RiskMap: Geo-Statistical Modeling Spatially Referenced Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://claudiofronterre.github.io/RiskMap/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {RiskMap: Geo-Statistical Modeling of Spatially Referenced Data},   author = {Emanuele Giorgi},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://claudiofronterre.github.io/RiskMap/}, }

title: Geo-Statistical Modeling of Spatially Referenced Data
text: RiskMap provides functions geo-statistical analysis continuous count data using maximum likelihood methods. models implemented package use stationary Gaussian processes Matern correlation function carry spatial prediction geographical area interest. underpinning theory methods implemented package found Diggle Giorgi (2019).

title: Geo-Statistical Modeling of Spatially Referenced Data
text: install stable version, use: development version can installed using devtools:
code: install.packages("RiskMap") # install.packages("devtools") # if not already installed devtools::install_github("claudiofronterre/RiskMap")

what: Laplace Sampling Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — Laplace_sampling_MCMC
title: Laplace Sampling Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — Laplace_sampling_MCMC
text: Performs MCMC sampling using Laplace approximation Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models (GLGPMs).

title: Laplace Sampling Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — Laplace_sampling_MCMC
code: Laplace_sampling_MCMC(   y,   units_m,   mu,   Sigma,   ID_coords,   ID_re = NULL,   sigma2_re = NULL,   family,   control_mcmc,   Sigma_pd = NULL,   mean_pd = NULL,   messages = TRUE )

title: Laplace Sampling Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — Laplace_sampling_MCMC
text: y Response variable vector. units_m Units measurement response variable. mu Mean vector response variable. Sigma Covariance matrix spatial process. ID_coords Indices mapping response locations. ID_re Indices mapping response unstructured random effects. sigma2_re Variance unstructured random effects. family Distribution family response variable. Must one 'gaussian', 'binomial', 'poisson'. control_mcmc List control parameters MCMC algorithm: n_sim Number MCMC iterations. burnin Number burn-iterations. thin Thinning parameter saving samples. h Step size proposal distribution. Defaults 1.65/(n_tot^(1/6)). c1.h, c2.h Parameters adaptive step size tuning. Sigma_pd Precision matrix (optional) Laplace approximation. mean_pd Mean vector (optional) Laplace approximation. messages Logical; TRUE, print progress messages.

title: Laplace Sampling Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — Laplace_sampling_MCMC
text: object class "mcmc.RiskMap" containing: samples$S Samples spatial process. samples$<re_names[]> Samples unstructured random effect, named according columns ID_re provided. tuning_par Vector step size (h) values used MCMC iterations. acceptance_prob Vector acceptance probabilities across MCMC iterations.

title: Laplace Sampling Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — Laplace_sampling_MCMC
text: function implements Laplace sampling MCMC approach GLGPMs. maximizes integrand using `maxim.integrand` function Laplace approximation `Sigma_pd` `mean_pd` provided. MCMC procedure involves adaptive step size adjustment based acceptance probability (`acc_prob`) uses Gaussian proposal distribution centered current mean (`mean_curr`) variance `h`.

title: Laplace Sampling Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — Laplace_sampling_MCMC
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk

title: Create Grid of Points Within Shapefile — create_grid
text: Generates grid points within given shapefile. grid points created based specified spatial resolution.

Create Grid of Points Within Shapefile — create_grid
text: shp object class 'sf' representing shapefile within grid points created. spat_res Numeric value specifying spatial resolution kilometers grid. grid_crs Coordinate reference system grid. NULL, CRS 'shp' used. shapefile 'shp' transformed CRS specified.

title: Create Grid of Points Within Shapefile — create_grid
text: 'sf' object containing generated grid points within shapefile.

title: Create Grid of Points Within Shapefile — create_grid
text: function creates grid points within boundaries provided shapefile ('shp'). grid points generated using specified spatial resolution ('spat_res'). coordinate reference system ('grid_crs') provided, shapefile transformed CRS creating grid.

title: Create Grid of Points Within Shapefile — create_grid
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk

title: Create Grid of Points Within Shapefile — create_grid
code: library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE  # Example shapefile data nc <- st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package="sf")) #> Reading layer `nc' from data source  #>   `/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/sf/shape/nc.shp' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' #> Simple feature collection with 100 features and 14 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -84.32385 ymin: 33.88199 xmax: -75.45698 ymax: 36.58965 #> Geodetic CRS:  NAD27  # Create grid with 10 km spatial resolution grid <- create_grid(nc, spat_res = 10) #> Warning: bounding box has potentially an invalid value range for longlat data #> Warning: bounding box has potentially an invalid value range for longlat data  # Plot the grid plot(st_geometry(nc))  plot(grid, add = TRUE, col = 'red')

title: Summaries of the distances — dist_summaries

title: Summaries of the distances — dist_summaries
Summaries of the distances — dist_summaries
text: data object class sf containing variable variogram computed coordinates convert_to_utm logical value, indicating conversion UTM shuold performed (convert_to_utm = TRUE) coordinate reference system data must used without conversion (convert_to_utm = FALSE). default convert_to_utm = TRUE. Note: convert_to_utm = TRUE conversion UTM performed using epsg provided propose_utm. scale_to_km logical value, indicating distances used variogram must scaled kilometers (scale_to_km = TRUE) left meters (scale_to_km = FALSE). default scale_to_km = FALSE

title: Summaries of the distances — dist_summaries
text: list containing following components min minimum distance max maximum distance mean mean distance median minimum distance

what: Estimation of Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm
title: Estimation of Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm
text: Fits generalized linear Gaussian process models spatial data, incorporating spatial Gaussian processes Matern correlation function. Supports Gaussian, binomial, Poisson response families.

title: Estimation of Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm
code: glgpm(   formula,   data,   family,   distr_offset = NULL,   cov_offset = NULL,   crs = NULL,   convert_to_crs = NULL,   scale_to_km = TRUE,   control_mcmc = set_control_sim(),   par0 = NULL,   S_samples = NULL,   return_samples = TRUE,   messages = TRUE,   fix_var_me = NULL,   start_pars = list(beta = NULL, sigma2 = NULL, tau2 = NULL, phi = NULL, sigma2_me =     NULL, sigma2_re = NULL) )

title: Estimation of Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm
text: formula formula object specifying model fitted. formula include fixed effects, random effects (specified using re()), spatial effects (specified using gp()). data data frame sf object containing variables model. family character string specifying distribution response variable. Must one "gaussian", "binomial", "poisson". distr_offset Optional offset binomial Poisson distributions. provided, defaults 1 binomial. cov_offset Optional numeric vector covariate offset. crs Optional integer specifying Coordinate Reference System (CRS) data sf object. Defaults 4326 (long/lat). convert_to_crs Optional integer specifying CRS convert spatial coordinates. scale_to_km Logical indicating whether scale coordinates kilometers. Defaults TRUE. control_mcmc Control parameters MCMC sampling. Must object class "mcmc.RiskMap" returned set_control_sim. par0 Optional list initial parameter values MCMC algorithm. S_samples Optional matrix pre-specified sample paths spatial random effect. return_samples Logical indicating whether return MCMC samples fitting Binomial Poisson model. Defaults FALSE. messages Logical indicating whether print progress messages. Defaults TRUE. fix_var_me Optional fixed value measurement error variance. start_pars Optional list starting values model parameters: beta (regression coefficients), sigma2 (spatial process variance), tau2 (nugget effect variance), phi (spatial correlation scale), sigma2_me (measurement error variance), sigma2_re (random effects variances).

title: Estimation of Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm
text: object class "RiskMap" containing fitted model relevant information: y Response variable. D Covariate matrix. coords Unique spatial coordinates. ID_coords Index coordinates. re Random effects. ID_re Index random effects. fix_tau2 Fixed nugget effect variance. fix_var_me Fixed measurement error variance. formula Model formula. family Response family. crs Coordinate Reference System. scale_to_km Indicator coordinates scaled kilometers. data_sf Original data sf object. kappa Spatial correlation parameter. units_m Distribution offset binomial/Poisson. cov_offset Covariate offset. call Matched call.

title: Estimation of Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm
text: Generalized linear Gaussian process models extend generalized linear models (GLMs) incorporating spatial Gaussian processes account spatial correlation data. function fits GLGPMs using maximum likelihood methods, allowing Gaussian, binomial, Poisson response families. case Binomial Poisson families, Monte Carlo maximum likelihood algorithm used. spatial Gaussian process modeled Matern correlation function, flexible commonly used geostatistical modeling. function supports spatial covariates unstructured random effects, providing comprehensive framework analyze spatially correlated data across different response distributions. Additionally, function allows inclusion unstructured random effects, specified re() term model formula. random effects can capture unexplained variability specific locations beyond fixed spatial covariate effects, enhancing model's flexibility capturing complex spatial patterns. convert_to_crs argument can used reproject spatial coordinates different CRS. scale_to_km argument scales coordinates kilometers set TRUE. control_mcmc argument specifies control parameters MCMC sampling. argument must object returned set_control_sim. start_pars argument allows specifying starting values model parameters. provided, default starting values used.

title: Estimation of Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk

what: Simulation from Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm_sim
title: Simulation from Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm_sim
text: Simulates data fitted Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Model (GLGPM) specified model formula data.

title: Simulation from Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm_sim
code: glgpm_sim(   n_sim,   model_fit = NULL,   formula = NULL,   data = NULL,   family = NULL,   distr_offset = NULL,   cov_offset = NULL,   crs = NULL,   convert_to_crs = NULL,   scale_to_km = TRUE,   control_mcmc = NULL,   sim_pars = list(beta = NULL, sigma2 = NULL, tau2 = NULL, phi = NULL, sigma2_me = NULL,     sigma2_re = NULL),   messages = TRUE )

title: Simulation from Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm_sim
text: n_sim Number simulations perform. model_fit Fitted GLGPM model object class 'RiskMap'. provided, overrides 'formula', 'data', 'family', 'crs', 'convert_to_crs', 'scale_to_km', 'control_mcmc' arguments. formula Model formula indicating variables model simulated. data Data frame 'sf' object containing variables model formula. family Distribution family response variable. Must one 'gaussian', 'binomial', 'poisson'. distr_offset Offset distributional part GLGPM. Required 'binomial' 'poisson' families. cov_offset Offset covariate part GLGPM. crs Coordinate reference system (CRS) code spatial data. convert_to_crs CRS code convert spatial data different 'crs'. scale_to_km Logical; TRUE, distances locations computed kilometers; FALSE, meters. control_mcmc Control parameters MCMC simulation applicable. sim_pars List simulation parameters including 'beta', 'sigma2', 'tau2', 'phi', 'sigma2_me', 'sigma2_re'. messages Logical; TRUE, display progress informative messages.

title: Simulation from Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm_sim
text: list containing simulated data, simulated spatial random effects (applicable), simulation parameters.

title: Simulation from Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm_sim
text: Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models (GLGPMs) extend generalized linear models (GLMs) incorporating spatial Gaussian processes model spatial correlation. function simulates data GLGPMs using Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods. supports Gaussian, binomial, Poisson response families, utilizing Matern correlation function model spatial dependence. simulation process involves generating spatially correlated random effects simulating responses based fitted specified model parameters. 'gaussian' family, function simulates response values adding measurement error. Additionally, GLGPMs can incorporate unstructured random effects specified re() term model formula, allowing capturing additional variability beyond fixed spatial covariate effects.

title: Simulation from Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — glgpm_sim
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk

title: Gaussian Process Model Specification — gp
text: Specifies terms, smoothness, nugget effect Gaussian Process (GP) model.

title: Gaussian Process Model Specification — gp
Gaussian Process Model Specification — gp
text: ... Variables representing spatial coordinates covariates GP model. kappa smoothness parameter \(\kappa\). Default 0.5. nugget nugget effect, represents variance measurement error. Default 0. positive numeric value must provided using default.

title: Gaussian Process Model Specification — gp
text: list class gp.spec containing following elements: term character vector specified terms. kappa smoothness parameter \(\kappa\). nugget nugget effect. dim number specified terms. label character string representing full call GP model.

title: Gaussian Process Model Specification — gp
text: function constructs list includes specified terms (spatial coordinates covariates), smoothness parameter \(\kappa\), nugget effect. list can used specification Gaussian Process model.

title: Gaussian Process Model Specification — gp
text: nugget effect must positive real number specified.

title: Gaussian Process Model Specification — gp
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk

what: Malaria Transmission in the Western Kenyan Highlands — malkenya
title: Malaria Transmission in the Western Kenyan Highlands — malkenya
text: dataset contains information 82014 individuals enrolled concurrent school community cross-sectional surveys, conducted 46 school clusters western Kenyan highlands. Malaria assessed rapid diagnostic test (RDT). variables follows: Cluster: unique ID 46 school clusters. Long: longitude coordinate household location. Lat: latitude coordinate household location. RDT: binary variable indicating outcome RDT:  1, positive, 0, negative. Gender: factor variable indicating gender sampled individual. Age: age years sampled individual. NetUse: binary variable indicating whether sampled individual  slept bed net previous night: 1, yes, 0, . MosqCntl: binary variable indicating whether household used kind   mosquito control, sprays coils: 1, yes, 0, . IRS: binary variables indicating whether indoor  residual spraying (IRS) house last 12 months: 1, yes, 0,  . Travel:  binary variable indicating whether sampled individual  traveled outside village last three months: 1, yes, 0,  . SES: ordinal variable indicating socio-economic status (SES)   household. variables integer score 1(=poor) 5(=rich). District: factor variable indicating village sampled  individual, "Kisii Central" "Rachuonyo". Survey: factor variable indicating survey  participant enrolled, "community" "school". elevation: elevation, meters, recorded household location

title: Matern Correlation Function — matern_cor
text: Computes Matern correlation function.

title: Matern Correlation Function — matern_cor
Matern Correlation Function — matern_cor
text: u vector distances pairs data locations. phi scale parameter \(\phi\). kappa smoothness parameter \(\kappa\). return_sym_matrix logical value indicating whether return symmetric correlation matrix. Defaults FALSE.

title: Matern Correlation Function — matern_cor
text: vector length u values Matern correlation function given distances, return_sym_matrix=FALSE. return_sym_matrix=TRUE, symmetric correlation matrix returned.

title: Matern Correlation Function — matern_cor
text: Matern correlation function defined

title: Matern Correlation Function — matern_cor
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk $$\rho(u; \phi; \kappa) = (2^{\kappa-1})^{-1}(u/\phi)^\kappa K_{\kappa}(u/\phi)$$ \(\phi\) \(\kappa\) scale smoothness parameters, \(K_{\kappa}(\cdot)\) denotes modified Bessel function third kind order \(\kappa\). parameters \(\phi\) \(\kappa\) must positive.

what: Maximization of the Integrand for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — maxim.integrand
title: Maximization of the Integrand for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — maxim.integrand
text: Maximizes integrand function Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models (GLGPMs), involves evaluation likelihood functions spatially correlated random effects.

title: Maximization of the Integrand for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — maxim.integrand
code: maxim.integrand(   y,   units_m,   mu,   Sigma,   ID_coords,   ID_re = NULL,   family,   sigma2_re = NULL,   hessian = FALSE,   gradient = FALSE )

title: Maximization of the Integrand for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — maxim.integrand
text: y Response variable vector. units_m Units measurement response variable. mu Mean vector response variable. Sigma Covariance matrix spatial process. ID_coords Indices mapping response locations. ID_re Indices mapping response unstructured random effects. family Distribution family response variable. Must one 'gaussian', 'binomial', 'poisson'. sigma2_re Variance unstructured random effects. hessian Logical; TRUE, compute Hessian matrix. gradient Logical; TRUE, compute gradient vector.

title: Maximization of the Integrand for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — maxim.integrand
text: list containing mode estimate, optionally, Hessian matrix gradient vector.

title: Maximization of the Integrand for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — maxim.integrand
text: function maximizes integrand GLGPMs using Nelder-Mead optimization algorithm. computes likelihood function incorporating spatial covariance unstructured random effects, provided. integrand includes terms spatial process (Sigma), unstructured random effects (sigma2_re), likelihood function (llik) based specified distribution family ('gaussian', 'binomial', 'poisson').

title: Maximization of the Integrand for Generalized Linear Gaussian Process Models — maxim.integrand
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk

Note: n_permutation = 0 running function s_variogram, function display error message envelope can generated. color plot_envelope = TRUE, sets colour envelope; run vignette("ggplot2-specs") details argument.

what: Prediction of the random effects components and covariates effects over a spatial grid using a fitted generalized linear Gaussian process model — pred_over_grid
title: Prediction of the random effects components and covariates effects over a spatial grid using a fitted generalized linear Gaussian process model — pred_over_grid
text: function computes predictions spatial grid using fitted model obtained glgpm function. provides point predictions uncertainty estimates specified locations component model separately: spatial random effects; unstructured random effects (included); covariates effects.

title: Prediction of the random effects components and covariates effects over a spatial grid using a fitted generalized linear Gaussian process model — pred_over_grid
code: pred_over_grid(   object,   grid_pred,   predictors = NULL,   re_predictors = NULL,   pred_cov_offset = NULL,   control_sim = set_control_sim(),   type = "marginal",   messages = TRUE )

title: Prediction of the random effects components and covariates effects over a spatial grid using a fitted generalized linear Gaussian process model — pred_over_grid
text: object RiskMap object obtained `glgpm` function. grid_pred object class 'sfc', representing spatial grid predictions made. Must coordinate reference system (CRS) object passed 'object'. predictors Optional. data frame containing predictor variables used prediction. re_predictors Optional. data frame containing predictors unstructured random effects, applicable. pred_cov_offset Optional. numeric vector specifying covariate offsets prediction locations. control_sim Control parameters MCMC sampling. Must object class "mcmc.RiskMap" returned set_control_sim. type Type prediction. "marginal" marginal predictions, "joint" joint predictions. messages Logical. TRUE, display progress messages. Default TRUE.

title: Prediction of the random effects components and covariates effects over a spatial grid using a fitted generalized linear Gaussian process model — pred_over_grid
text: object class 'RiskMap.pred.re' containing predicted values, uncertainty estimates,         additional information.

title: Prediction of the random effects components and covariates effects over a spatial grid using a fitted generalized linear Gaussian process model — pred_over_grid
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk

what: Predictive Target over a Shapefile — pred_target_shp
title: Predictive Target over a Shapefile — pred_target_shp
text: Computes predictions shapefile using outputs pred_over_grid function. function allows incorporating covariates, offsets, optional unstructured random effects predictive target.

title: Predictive Target over a Shapefile — pred_target_shp
code: pred_target_shp(   object,   shp,   shp_target = mean,   weights = NULL,   standardize_weights = FALSE,   col_names = NULL,   include_covariates = TRUE,   include_nugget = FALSE,   include_cov_offset = FALSE,   include_re = FALSE,   f_target = NULL,   pd_summary = NULL )

title: Predictive Target over a Shapefile — pred_target_shp
text: object Output `pred_over_grid`, RiskMap.pred.re object. shp Spatial dataset (sf data.frame) representing shapefile predictions computed. shp_target Function defining aggregation method shapefile targets (default mean). weights Optional numeric vector weights spatial predictions. standardize_weights Logical indicating whether standardize weights (default FALSE). col_names Column name index 'shp' containing region names. include_covariates Logical indicating whether include covariates predictions (default TRUE). include_nugget Logical indicating whether include nugget effect (default FALSE). include_cov_offset Logical indicating whether include covariate offset predictions (default FALSE). include_re Logical indicating whether include random effects predictions (default FALSE). f_target List target functions apply linear predictor samples. pd_summary List summary functions (e.g., mean, sd) summarize target samples.

title: Predictive Target over a Shapefile — pred_target_shp
text: object class 'RiskMap_pred_target_shp' containing computed targets, summaries, associated spatial data.

what: Print Summary of RiskMap Model — print.summary.RiskMap

Print Summary of RiskMap Model — print.summary.RiskMap
text: x object class "summary.RiskMap". ... parameters.

title: Print Summary of RiskMap Model — print.summary.RiskMap
text: function used side effect printing console. return value.

title: Print Summary of RiskMap Model — print.summary.RiskMap
text: function prints detailed summary fitted "RiskMap" model, including: type geostatistical model (e.g., Gaussian, Binomial, Poisson). Confidence intervals parameter estimates. Regression coefficients standard errors p-values. Measurement error variance, applicable. Spatial process parameters, including Matern covariance parameters. Variance nugget effect, applicable. Unstructured random effects variances, applicable. Log-likelihood model. Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) Gaussian models.

title: Print Summary of RiskMap Model — print.summary.RiskMap
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk

title: Empirical variogram — s_variogram
text: Computes empirical variogram using “bins” distance provided user.

title: Empirical variogram — s_variogram
code: s_variogram(   data,   variable,   bins = NULL,   n_permutation = 0,   convert_to_utm = TRUE,   scale_to_km = FALSE )

title: Empirical variogram — s_variogram
text: data object class sf containing variable variogram computed coordinates variable character indicating name variable variogram computed. bins vector indicating `bins` used define classes distance used computation variogram. default bins=NULL bins computed seq(0, d_max/2, length=15) d_max maximum distance observed data. n_permutation non-negative integer indicating number permutation used compute 95 level envelope assumption spatial independence. default n_permutation=0, envelope generated. convert_to_utm logical value, indicating conversion UTM shuold performed (convert_to_utm = TRUE) coordinate reference system data must used without conversion (convert_to_utm = FALSE). default convert_to_utm = TRUE. Note: convert_to_utm = TRUE conversion UTM performed using epsg provided propose_utm. scale_to_km logical value, indicating distances used variogram must scaled kilometers (scale_to_km = TRUE) left meters (scale_to_km = FALSE). default scale_to_km = FALSE

title: Empirical variogram — s_variogram
text: object class 'variogram' list containing following components variogram data-frame containing following columns: mid_points, middle points classes distance provided bins; obs_vari values observed variogram; obs_vari number pairs. n_permutation > 0, data-frame also contains lower_bound upper_bound corresponding lower upper bounds 95 used assess departure observed variogram assumption spatial independence. scale_to_km value passed scale_to_km n_permutation number permutations

title: Empirical variogram — s_variogram
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk

what: Set Control Parameters for Simulation — set_control_sim
title: Set Control Parameters for Simulation — set_control_sim
text: function sets control parameters running simulations, particularly MCMC methods. allows users specify number simulations, burn-period, thinning interval, various parameters necessary simulation.

title: Set Control Parameters for Simulation — set_control_sim
code: set_control_sim(   n_sim = 12000,   burnin = 2000,   thin = 10,   h = NULL,   c1.h = 0.01,   c2.h = 1e-04,   linear_model = FALSE )

title: Set Control Parameters for Simulation — set_control_sim
text: n_sim Integer. total number simulations run. Default 12000. burnin Integer. number initial simulations discard (burn-period, used MCMC algorithm). Default 2000. thin Integer. interval simulations recorded (thinning interval, used MCMC algorithm). Default 10. h Numeric. optional parameter. Must non-negative specified. c1.h Numeric. control parameter simulation. Must positive. Default 0.01. c2.h Numeric. Another control parameter simulation. Must 0 1. Default 1e-04. linear_model Logical. TRUE, function sets parameters linear model returns n_sim. Default FALSE.

title: Set Control Parameters for Simulation — set_control_sim
text: list control parameters simulation class attribute "mcmc.RiskMap".

title: Set Control Parameters for Simulation — set_control_sim
text: function validates input parameters ensures appropriate simulation used glgpm fitting function. non-linear models, checks n_sim greater burnin, thin positive divisor (n_sim - burnin), h, c1.h, c2.h within respective valid ranges. linear_model TRUE, n_sim linear_model required, function returns list containing parameters. linear_model FALSE, function returns list containing n_sim, burnin, thin, h, c1.h, c2.h, linear_model.

title: Set Control Parameters for Simulation — set_control_sim
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk

title: Set Control Parameters for Simulation — set_control_sim
code: # Example with default parameters control_params <- set_control_sim()  # Example with custom parameters control_params <- set_control_sim(n_sim = 15000, burnin = 3000, thin = 20)

title: Summarize Model Fits — summary.RiskMap
text: Provides summary method "RiskMap" class computes standard errors p-values likelihood-based model fits.

title: Summarize Model Fits — summary.RiskMap
code: # S3 method for class 'RiskMap' summary(object, ..., conf_level = 0.95)

title: Summarize Model Fits — summary.RiskMap
text: object object class "RiskMap" obtained result call glgpm. ... parameters. conf_level confidence level intervals (default 0.95).

title: Summarize Model Fits — summary.RiskMap
text: list containing: reg_coef matrix estimates, standard errors, z-values, p-values, confidence intervals regression coefficients. matrix estimates confidence intervals measurement error variance, applicable. sp matrix estimates confidence intervals spatial process parameters. tau2 fixed nugget variance, applicable. ranef matrix estimates confidence intervals random effects variances, applicable. conf_level confidence level used intervals. family family model (e.g., "gaussian"). kappa kappa parameter model. log.lik log-likelihood model fit. cov_offset_used logical indicating covariance offset used. aic Akaike Information Criterion (AIC) model, applicable.

title: Summarize Model Fits — summary.RiskMap
text: function computes standard errors p-values parameters "RiskMap" model, adjusting covariance structure needed.

title: Summarize Model Fits — summary.RiskMap
text: Handles Gaussian non-Gaussian families, accounts fixed random effects model.

title: Summarize Model Fits — summary.RiskMap
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk

title: Create LaTeX Table from Model Fit — to_table

Random effects variances. Measurement error variance, applicable. xtable object can customized using additional arguments printed LaTeX HTML table.

what: Covariates Dataset for Malaria Prediction in Tanzania — tz_covariates
title: Covariates Dataset for Malaria Prediction in Tanzania — tz_covariates
text: dataset provides covariates 10 10 km regular grid covering Tanzania. intended used together `tz_malaria` dataset spatial prediction malaria prevalence.

title: Covariates Dataset for Malaria Prediction in Tanzania — tz_covariates
Covariates Dataset for Malaria Prediction in Tanzania — tz_covariates
text: data frame 8740 observations 8 variables: Population Population density area (thousands). ITN Percentage households least one insecticide-treated net (ITN). EVI Enhanced Vegetation Index, indicating vegetation density. Temperature Average temperature degrees Celsius. NTL Nighttime light intensity, indicating urbanization infrastructure. Precipitation Total precipitation millimeters. utm_x UTM (Universal Transverse Mercator) x-coordinate grid point. utm_y UTM (Universal Transverse Mercator) y-coordinate grid point. CRS UTM coordinates 32736.

title: Covariates Dataset for Malaria Prediction in Tanzania — tz_covariates
text: Giorgi E, Fronterrè C, Macharia PM, Alegana VA, Snow RW, Diggle PJ. 2021 Model building assessment impact covariates disease prevalence mapping low-resource settings: explain predict. J. R. Soc. Interface 18: 20210104. https://doi.org/10.1098/rsif.2021.0104

what: Malaria Dataset from Tanzania Demographic Health Surveys 2015 — tz_malaria
title: Malaria Dataset from Tanzania Demographic Health Surveys 2015 — tz_malaria
text: dataset contains information malaria prevalence associated variables 2015 Tanzania Demographic Health Surveys. data includes geographical, demographic, environmental, health-related variables.

title: Malaria Dataset from Tanzania Demographic Health Surveys 2015 — tz_malaria
Malaria Dataset from Tanzania Demographic Health Surveys 2015 — tz_malaria
text: data frame 387 rows 20 columns, containing following variables: cluster.number Cluster number, identifying survey cluster. Lat Latitude survey cluster. Long Longitude survey cluster. MM Month survey (two-digit format). YY Year survey. UpAge Upper age limit surveyed individuals years. LoAge Lower age limit surveyed individuals years. Ex Number individuals examined malaria. Pf Number individuals tested positive Plasmodium falciparum (malaria parasite). PfPR2.10 Plasmodium falciparum parasite rate population (aged 2-10 years). Method Method used malaria diagnosis (e.g., Rapid Diagnostic Test (RDT)). EVI Enhanced Vegetation Index, indicating vegetation density. Temperature Average temperature degrees Celsius. Precipitation Total precipitation millimeters. Population Population density area (thousands). ITN Percentage households least one insecticide-treated net (ITN). NTL Nighttime light intensity, indicating urbanization infrastructure. Urban.Rural Indicator whether area urban ('U') rural ('R'). utm_x UTM (Universal Transverse Mercator) x-coordinate survey cluster. utm_y UTM (Universal Transverse Mercator) y-coordinate survey cluster. CRS UTM coordinates 32736.

title: Malaria Dataset from Tanzania Demographic Health Surveys 2015 — tz_malaria
text: Tanzania Demographic Health Surveys 2015, Giorgi E, Fronterrè C, Macharia PM, Alegana VA, Snow RW, Diggle PJ. 2021 Model building assessment impact covariates disease prevalence mapping low-resource settings: explain predict. J. R. Soc. Interface 18: 20210104. https://doi.org/10.1098/rsif.2021.0104

what: Update Predictors for a RiskMap Prediction Object — update_predictors
title: Update Predictors for a RiskMap Prediction Object — update_predictors
text: function updates predictors given RiskMap prediction object. ensures new predictors match original prediction grid updates relevant components object accordingly.

title: Update Predictors for a RiskMap Prediction Object — update_predictors
Update Predictors for a RiskMap Prediction Object — update_predictors
text: object `RiskMap.pred.re` object, output pred_over_grid function. predictors data frame containing new predictor values. number rows must match prediction grid `object`.

title: Update Predictors for a RiskMap Prediction Object — update_predictors
text: updated `RiskMap.pred.re` object.

title: Update Predictors for a RiskMap Prediction Object — update_predictors
text: function performs several checks updates: Ensures `object` class `RiskMap.pred.re`. Ensures number rows `predictors` matches prediction grid `object`. Removes rows missing values `predictors` updates corresponding components `object`. Updates prediction locations, predictive samples random effects, linear predictor.

title: Update Predictors for a RiskMap Prediction Object — update_predictors
text: Emanuele Giorgi e.giorgi@lancaster.ac.uk Claudio Fronterre c.fronterr@lancaster.ac.uk
